document_data.name: Fourstaves House

document_data.mainbody: '''Fourstaves House''', or '''Thingoleir Mansion''', was the home of the extended [[Thingoleir]] family in [[Yhaunn]], named after the four prominent Thingoleir wizards who lived there.
document_data.Location: Fourstaves was located in the northwest of Yhaunn in a prosperous neighbourhood, just south of the [[Roadkeep]] along the cliffs. It was considered a local landmark.
document_data.Structure: Fourstaves House was a large and well-appointed family hall. In addition to typical living arrangements, it had room for the family of wizards (and one sorcerer) to practice their craft, with the north wing of the mansion devoted to their studies. [[Strasus Thingoleir|Strasus]], [[Dagnalla Irongard|Dagnalla]], and [[Roderio Thingoleir|Roderio]] each had a private workshop, while [[Malia Thingoleir|Malia]] and [[Krin Foxrun|Krin]] shared one. There was also a library on arcane subjects that the whole family used.
document_data.Defenses:
As befitting the home of five mages, the entire house was layered with defensive magic that could block or destroy intruders. Three animated stone mastiffs guarded the front door, challenging anyone who approached. 

Internally, the defensive wards increased with proximity to the wizard's studies in the north wing, which often contained valuable or dangerous projects. As all the members of the family were implicitly trusted, all of the wards would allow passage to them. Only a few trusted house servants were able to bypass these most secure wards.

Strasus' workshop had an animated [[copper hawk]] that could blast intruders with lightning.
document_data.History:
When Strasus and Dagnalla first moved to Yhaunn as a married couple, they built a family home and named it Twostaves House, with its completion coinciding with the day of Malia's birth. When their children Malia and Roderio completed their apprenticeships, it was renamed to Threestaves and Fourstaves, respectively. Although it was also eventually home to the [[sorcerer]] [[Krin Foxrun]], the family decided against naming it Fivestaves in order to avoid offending the magicless Keph.Krin also used wands rather than a stave, for what that is worth.

In [[Kythorn]] of [[1373 DR]], Strasus took custody of a collection of ancient artifacts recovered from the tunnels around Yhaunn, including ''[[The Leaves of One Night]]''. They were stored in his workshop while he and his family studied them and entertained theories of their origin.

In [[Eleasis]] the same year, Keph used ''[[magesbane dust]]'' to sabotage Roderio's alchemical workshop out of spite. He unwittingly used too much, and the reaction destroyed the workshop and almost killed Roderio.

[[Eleasis 15|A few days later]], Keph entered Strasus' workshop in order to steal ''The Leaves'' for [[Variance Amatick]], overcoming the copper hawk by hitting it with a stool.
document_data.Inhabitants: Fourstaves House was home to the entire Thingoleir family. Within it lived the retired [[Adventurer|ex-adventurers]] [[Strasus Thingoleir]] and [[Dagnalla Irongard]], their children [[Malia Thingoleir|Malia]], [[Roderio Thingoleir|Roderio]] and [[Keph Thingoleir|Keph]], Malia's husband [[Krin Foxrun]], and their child [[Adrey Foxrun]]. In addition to the family, the household was maintained by a cohort of servants who had limited access to the more secure areas of the hall.
